channel.title: mod_type on ThingsDB documentation
channel.description: Recent content in mod_type on ThingsDB documentation

item.title: add
item.description: Adds a property to an existing Type. If there are active instances of the type you want to modify, then an initial_value is required. This value is used only once for applying the value to the existing instances and is not used when new instances are created. Action mod_type(type_name, 'add', property_name, property_type, [initial_value]) Arguments Argument Type Description type_name str Name of the Type where the property has to be added to.

item.title: del
item.description: Deletes a property from an existing Type. The property will be removed from all the active instances of that Type. Action mod_type(type_name, 'del', property_name) Arguments Argument Type Description type_name str Name of the Type where the property has to be removed from. 'del' str Passing this argument will result in a delete action. property_name str Name of the property that has to be removed.

item.title: mod
item.description: Modifies the type definition of a property from an existing Type. When modifying a property of a Type, the changed property type can only be less ‘strict’. So for example, age: 'int' can become age: 'int?', but not the other way around. Action mod_type(type_name, 'mod', property_name, property_type) Arguments Argument Type Description type_name str Name of the Type where the property has to be modified from.
